title: Here's why some people STILL believe the Earth is flat
description: Flat Earth videos rack up huge views on the Internet — but how could anyone believe such a fundamentally false idea? Daily Beast reporter Kelly Weill joins John Avlon on this week's Reality Check to discuss her new book and explain how social media has given an old conspiracy theory a huge boost.

title: How geolocation shows Russia has been shelling civilians in Kharkiv
description: As the shells started raining down on the civilians of Kharkiv, Ukraine's second largest city, CNN's investigative team began building an evidence base for potential war crimes.

title: Bull rider gets bucked off. His father's next move went viral
description: Footage shows 18-year-old Cody Hooks being bucked off the bull at a rodeo in Texas. His father quickly runs out to shield his son as the bull charges toward them.

title: Republicans have a Marjorie Taylor Greene problem
description: While Republican leaders like Kevin McCarthy condemn Georgia Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene's controversial actions and words, they never actually punish her. CNN's Chris Cillizza explains why that's the case.

title: Here's what we know about the 40-mile-long Russian convoy outside Ukraine's capital
description: For days, residents of Kyiv had been bracing themselves for a 40-mile-long convoy of Russian tanks, armored vehicles, and towed artillery to arrive for an assault on the Ukrainian capital.

title: Russia refuses to launch internet satellites, pointing at sanctions
description:
• Analysis: Shifting Ukraine map makes Russia's intentions clearer
• Video: Maps explain what Putin's after

title: France seizes superyacht owned by sanctioned Russian oligarch
France seizes Russian oligarch's superyacht
description: France has seized a yacht owned by Russian oligarch Igor Sechin, the French finance ministry said in a statement on Thursday.

title: Europe is making once-unimaginable decisions to counter Putin's aggression
description: Whatever the ultimate outcome of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, President Vladimir Putin has succeeded in one thing: the security map of Europe has been fundamentally altered and things will never return to the way they were before.

title: Distribution of White supremacist propaganda reached the second-highest level in 2021, ADL says
description: The distribution of White supremacist propaganda in 2021 reached the second-highest level recorded since the Anti-Defamation League began tracking it, the group announced on Thursday.

title: Russians struggle to understand Ukraine war: 'We didn't choose this'
description: Nineteen-year-old Tasya stood with her friends on a cold morning in the Russian city of St. Petersburg as they joined protesters' chants against the Russian invasion of Ukraine: "Nyet Voine!" ("No to War!").

title: Russian and Belarusian athletes to no longer compete at 2022 Winter Paralympics after multiple protests, IPC says
description: Russian and Belarusian athletes will no longer be able to compete at the 2022 Winter Paralympics in Beijing after multiple teams threatened not to compete at the Games, the International Paralympic Committee (IPC) said on Thursday.

title: He helped her connect with her birth family. They became best friends for life
description: Linsay DeBates was adopted from South Korea by an American family when she was six months old. She didn't return to the country of her birth for almost two decades.

title: Lviv resident's message to Putin: 'He can go f**k himself'
description: CNN's Anderson Cooper reports from Lviv, Ukraine, as residents gear up for war amid Russia's invasion of the country.

title: Ukrainian civilians stare down Russian military convoy
description: Civilians in Melitopol, Ukraine, stood in the road to block a Russian military convoy from advancing before eventually being forced aside. The video emerged on social media on Tuesday, March 1st.

title: Tiger Woods wins $8M award for generating positive media interest on PGA Tour -- despite playing just one tournament
description: Tiger Woods has won the inaugural Player Impact Program (PIP) award, despite only playing in one tournament in 2021.

title: Russia says its economy is taking 'serious blows' as isolation grows
Trump and right-wing lawyer were part of 'criminal conspiracy' to overturn 2020 election, January 6 committee alleges
Why Texas is a legal graveyard for Biden policies
description: If a federal judge is ruling against a Biden administration policy, there is a good chance the judge's courtroom is in Texas.

title: F1 world champion Max Verstappen signs new deal with Red Bull Racing until 2028
description: After winning his first world title last year, Max Verstappen has signed a long-term contract extension with Red Bull Racing which will keep him with the team until 2028.

title: Tiny 'flower' formation spotted on Mars by Curiosity rover
description: This may be the closest we will ever come to finding a flower on Mars.

title: Face masks expired? How to tell, plus why you should hold onto them despite easing restrictions
description: Mask mandates may be lifting in many parts of the United States, but don't ditch your face coverings just yet.

title: One million refugees flee Ukraine as Russia escalates bombardment of key cities
description: Russia's relentless bombardment of residential areas across Ukraine has so far forced more than one million refugees to flee the country, according to the United Nations, as fierce fighting continues into its second week.

title: Amilcar Djau Codjovi: Rising soccer star's harrowing escape from Ukraine
description: With sirens blaring and explosions in the distance, it suddenly dawned on a fearful 20-year-old soccer player that he was in the middle of a warzone.

title: NFT backed by Pussy Riot member raises $6.7 million for Ukraine
description: An NFT of Ukraine's flag has raised over $6.7 million for the country's defenses as cryptocurrency donations continue to flood in following the Russian invasion.

title: China asked Russia to delay Ukraine invasion until after Olympics, Western intel shows
description: A Western intelligence report indicated that Chinese officials in early February requested that senior Russian officials wait until after the Beijing Olympics had finished before beginning an invasion into Ukraine, US officials said Wednesday.

title: Lindsey Graham says Trump calling Putin genius was 'a mistake'
description: Sen. Lindsey Graham, a Republican from South Carolina, said on Wednesday that he thinks it "was a mistake" for former President Donald Trump to call Russian President Vladimir Putin a genius.

title: Analysis: Fears mount of a horrific Russian escalation in Ukraine
description: The die is being cast in Ukraine for a long, bloody war of attrition that threatens mass civilian deaths, a catastrophic refugee crisis and a geostrategic shake-up that would cement a new age of confrontation between the US and Russia.

title: 'We walked 8 miles with a newborn': US couple's dangerous escape from Ukraine
description: Jacob and Jessie Boeckmann describe their dangerous escape from Ukraine to the United States with their newborn who was born two days before Russia's invasion.

title: Rep. Boebert interrupts Biden's speech before he mentions deceased son
description: Rep. Lauren Boebert (R-CO) interrupted President Joe Biden's State of the Union speech when he was speaking about US military deaths caused by exposure to burn pits, and just before Biden talked about his deceased son Beau Biden.

title: See game show moment some say is 'most painful 2 minutes' ever
description: Wheel of Fortune's feather fiasco has been called by some the show's "most painful 2 minutes" ever. CNN's Jeanne Moos follows the feather.

title: 'Jeopardy!' contestant takes off wig to normalize cancer recovery
description: Christine Whelchel auditioned for the popular game show "Jeopardy!" after being diagnosed with cancer. Now, cancer-free, the champion has a message to the world.
